segment.source: You can use the following procedure to delete a package, including all versions of the package, from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to delete a package, including all versions of the package, from the Application Virtualization Server Management Console.

segment.source: You might do this for easier management of files on the server or to remove a package and replace it with a more stable one.
segment.target: You might do this for easier management of files on the server or to remove a package and replace it with a more stable one.

segment.source: When you choose to delete a package, a confirmation box reminds you that this action deletes all its versions.
segment.target: When you choose to delete a package, a confirmation box reminds you that this action deletes all its versions.

segment.source: The server will no longer be able to stream the application.
segment.target: The server will no longer be able to stream the application.

segment.source: In the left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Packages.
segment.target: In the left pane of the Application Virtualization Server Management Console, expand Packages.

segment.source: In the menu tree pane, right-click the package you want to delete and choose Delete.
segment.target: In the menu tree pane, right-click the package you want to delete and choose Delete.

segment.source: Read the confirmation window, and click Yes to complete the action.
segment.target: Read the confirmation window, and click Yes to complete the action.

segment.source: How to Delete a Package Version
segment.target: How to Delete a Package Version

segment.source: How to Manage Packages in the Server Management Console
segment.target: How to Manage Packages in the Server Management Console
